intro: Bidens ternata, commonly known as common tickseed, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellow-orange flowers with ray florets. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Bidens ternata is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
